description: Number of books required for n book-lengths of overhang in the harmonic book stapling problem. Sum (1/i,i=1..a(n)) >= 2n and Sum (1/i,i=1..a(n)-1) < 2n.
references: R. L. Graham, D. E. Knuth and O. Patashnik, Concrete Mathematics. Addison-Wesley, Reading, MA, 1990, p. 259.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..350
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Book Stacking Problem
formula: a(n) = A002387(2n), n>=1. Least a(n) with H(a(n))>2n with the harmonic numbers H(k):= A001008(k)/A002805(k).
mathematica: f[n_] := (k = Floor[ N [ E^(n - EulerGamma) + 1/(2n), 24]] - 2; While[ Floor[ N[ Log[k] + EulerGamma + 1/(2k) - 1/(12k^2) + 1/(120k^4), 24]] < n, k++ ]; k); Table[ f[n], {n, 2, 32, 2} ]a[n_] := k /. FindRoot[ HarmonicNumber[k] == 2*n, {k, Exp[2*n]}, WorkingPrecision -> 100] // Ceiling; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 100}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jun 25 2013 *)
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
extensions: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 06 2001
